posts.name: Daniel Wenbo
posts.cooked: My tean wants to upload our program project on Github. And l think we shouldn‚Äôt upload the /build folder. But when l init the whole folder with git. It seems that it is impossible to avoid uploading the /build folder every time l want to make a commit. Is there any solution to this?

posts.name: Jack
posts.cooked: Using a .gitignore should be work for this. The documentation is quite useful

posts.name: Daniel Wenbo
posts.cooked:
Thanks. Which folder aren‚Äôt necessary to be uploaded?

Edit: Is there any solution to generate this file automatically?

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked:
When you created the robot project with vscode, it should have included a .gitignore file.

If you accidentally deleted it, you can find it here.

posts.name: Daniel Wenbo
posts.cooked:
Thanks , l have copied it to my .gitignore. But every time l build my code , it still has some files which can also be uploaded. image 818√ó557 11.8 KB

image 818√ó557 11.8 KB

image 818√ó557 11.8 KB

.gradle is listed in the .gitignore file, so that folder should be ignored ‚Ä¶ from now on. But if you originally committed files in that folder to github, before you listed .gradle in .gitignore , they‚Äôre tracked until you manually remove them from git.

posts.name: Daniel Wenbo
posts.cooked: Thanks ,l have created a new project and replace it with my own /src and it now works perfectly.
I‚Äôd recommend reading up on the proper way to use git add and git remove in commits. Can help alleviate stuff like this quickly.

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked: I recommend making sure you commit the .gitignore file to the repo. So that any future clones of the repo will include it.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
